bio: Oliver Jeffers is a British artist and illustrator who is known for his children's books and his distinctive, imaginative style. He was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland in 1977, and began his career as an artist in the early 2000s, when he started creating illustrations for magazines and other publications. Jeffers is best known for his children's books, which often feature characters and stories that are imaginative, humorous, and thought-provoking. His books have been widely praised for their creativity and their ability to engage young readers, and have been translated into numerous languages. Jeffers has received numerous awards and accolades for his work, and is highly regarded within the children's literature community.
